head.title: Great Outdoors Is Now a Game

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Media, Entertainment and Publishing

hedline.hl1: Great Outdoors Is Now a Game

abstract.p: ESPN creates and organizes Great Outdoor Games; more than 200 competitors in 21 events vie for prizes in fishing and other outdoor events (S)

block.p: Sports has gone to the dogs, and fish, and ax-wielders. In its never-endingpursuit of programming, ESPN created and organized the Great Outdoor Games, which started Thursday and end today in Lake Placid, N.Y. More than 200 competitors in 21 events are vying for $300,000 in prizes.

Sports has gone to the dogs, and fish, and ax-wielders. In its never-endingpursuit of programming, ESPN created and organized the Great Outdoor Games, which started Thursday and end today in Lake Placid, N.Y. More than 200 competitors in 21 events are vying for $300,000 in prizes.

The anglers, strongmen, strongwomen and, yes, dogs, are scheduled for 17.5 hours of coverage on ESPN next week. The bass fishing, fly casting, fetching, jumping, archery, rifle, shotgun and timber events (tree topping, timed chain sawing, etc.), can be seen, starting Thursday.
